body_html:
In order to finish this, I have a few questions:

  1. Can I delete the routing tests? Or what do I do with them?
  2. When I type /conferences/new url, I expect one of two things: either a message that the route doesn't exist, or a message that acces is denied. However, I get a message: Couldn't find conference with id=new. Is this okay, or did I do something wrong with either authorization or the routing?
  3. Because all the CRUD is behind the orga base controller, I removed all can? :crud, Conference-checks in the CRUD views. okay, right? But what about the load_and_authorize_resource? (It is in both conferences_controllers.)
  4. I tried to add a validation to ensure that the end_date will be after the start_date. (issue #503 nr 2) But... it would not allow for ANY end date at all, so I removed it in a later commit. Any suggestions?

(ping @carpodaster , @michaelem , @ramonh )

body:
In order to finish this, I have a few questions:
1) Can I delete the routing tests? Or what do I do with them?
2) When I type `/conferences/new` url, I expect one of two things: either a message that the route doesn't exist, or a message that acces is denied. However, I get a message:  `Couldn't find conference with id=new`.  Is this okay, or did I do something wrong with either authorization or the routing?
3) Because all the CRUD is behind the orga base controller, I removed all `can? :crud, Conference`-checks in the CRUD views. okay, right? But what about the `load_and_authorize_resource`? (It is in both conferences_controllers.)  
4) I tried to [add a validation](https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/rgsoc-teams/pull/546/commits/50d659c38edb806d58e94752aac9eb80e682e891) to ensure that the end_date will be after the start_date. (issue #503 nr 2) But... it would not allow for ANY end date at all, so I removed it in a later commit. Any suggestions?

(ping @carpodaster , @michaelem , @ramonh )
